alert.note: Alert for Larimer (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 24 at 10:54AM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Central Larimer county Colorado. * WHEN...Until 100 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry gulches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1052 AM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Up to 0.5 inches of rain have fallen in the last 45 minutes. - The heaviest rain has been in the area north of Sky Ranch, but additional storms are now in the Pingree Park area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pingree Park. - This includes the following additional locations... Poudre Springs, Upper Pingree Park Road and Sky Ranch.
info.instruction: Heavy Rainfall will cause minor flooding of creeks and streams, roads and roadside culverts in the affected part of the Cameron Peak burn area. The heavy rains could also trigger rock slides or debris flows.
